docs.lead_paragraph: EACH year Americans pay about $1 billion for the care of a body part they apparently can live very well without--the gallbladder. This three-inch, pear-shaped organ is the storage depot for bile, a substance produced by the liver which is essential for the digestion and absorption of fats.
